content: gee thanks for resetting all my customizations back to their really terrible blue sky defaults. yes, I haven't used the app in a while. I'm guessing it was a app update that blew out my customizations. the app should mimic normal thunderstorm effects upon installation/default settings. put a demo mode in if you want to show off what the app can do. also, put in a function to backup user's customized settings so when garbage like this happens, one can simply restore their customizations.
replyContent: Sorry to hear you lost your custom settings. The settings are stored locally on your device and should have remained intact after updating unless you previously uninstalled the app. I apologize for this inconvenience and I hope you still like the app despite this. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.dev if you have any questions.

content: Its ok but the lightning color adjustment needs work, you can't make bolts 'slightly' any color, any color chosen displays with heavy saturation. Like lightning on Jupiter or something. Also, there is a highly annoying, repetitive gap between loops. Must either eliminate gap or randomize routine and make it endless.
Pretty unimpressive as a light show, index somewhat irritating. I have asked for a refund.
replyContent: Sorry to hear you don't like the app. Each mode offers a different thunderstorm experience with different intensities. You can further customize your experience on the Settings screen to create the perfect storm for you. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.dev for help.

content: I like Hue thunder more 4.0
replyContent: Hi Robin, please let me know if you have any suggestions for improvement at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.dev. You may find that it has more customization options than Hue Thunder in order to create the perfect storm for you. I'm happy to help!

content: Very good app only suggestion is an on demand button for lightning and maybe Google Assistant integration. Would be a great addition for Halloween!

I definitely needed to adjust the default settings before it felt anything like a real thunderstorm. It was worth it. Played through the home stereo, this app very realisticly imitates the thunderstorms we have here. Even my dogs want to go hide from the rain, lol. Dropped a star because it did take a lot of tweaking and there's room for improvement but overall I'm impressed with this app. I just noticed the cats running for shelter when the "lightning" strikes, lol
Work on quality of the sounds of the rain, other things are great
Amazed from the second I booted the app. I was looking to write a Python code myself but this is so much better than I could do! Great personalization and functions. Awesome app!!!
replyContent: Thank you!

content: Great app! Love the ability to have red lightning. Sometime my son and I just let the app roll while playing online games. Any chance it will work with the new Phillips WIZ lights?
replyContent: Thank you, Greg! The Philips Hue Bridge and compatible Hue lights are required, so unfortunately, the Philips WiZ lights will not work. Please contact support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.dev if you have any other questions. Thanks!

content: App works great. Lighting strikes are on point. I used a soundbar for audio & the delay function worked seamlessly keeping the strikes on que with the flashes of light on the bulbs.
replyContent: Thank you!

content: Amazing app! The idea of an indoor thunderstorm popped into my head this morning and thank God Scott had already had this idea before me! It's everything I was hoping to find in this app (the fault is in Alexa. She can't open apps.) The light effects are so natural and lifelike. He really nailed this one. The thunderstorm takes me back to my childhood. I love the whole thing! The app creator is pretty swell, too.
Cool app. Is there any way to turn off the blue lights and only have the rain sound and white lights flash to the lightning effect?
replyContent: Hi Jeff, under Settings, you can set Sky to min brightness and turn off the Rain Light FX. Please contact support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.dev if you have something else in mind. Thanks!

content: Love this app. Wish you had a beta program!
I love the app but I must keep pushing the button on the Hue bridge every time I use it. I live in the basement and the bridge is upstairs. I read a similar review from someone else.
replyContent: Hi Jeffrey, thank you for the feedback! Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.dev for help. UPDATE: Please install the latest version (5.0.0) and let me know if the issue persists. Thanks!

content: This is just plain fun, and works out of the box. I can tell it's a lot of work, so it's a steal for the price. Planning a thunderstorm for our indoor camping adventure and this seemed perfect when I tried it just now. Have grabbed the other apps to shake up the isolation days with the kids. Looking forward to our volcano adventure! Great app, give it a shot!
replyContent: Thank you so much!!

content: Seems to work best with fewer lights. I've greatly expanded my hue bulb collection and now notice that there must be a lag between syncing all of them and the sound from the app. It went from the lights flashing and soon after hearing the thunder (correct) where now with all lights going (about 20), you hear the thunder first followed by the lights flashing a few seconds after, which is backwards. Delay Thunder does not resolve it. Any tips for this issue outside of using less lights?
replyContent: Hi Matt, thank you for the feedback! Please try creating a new group with a max of 10 lights that will be used for the lightning effects. Go to Settings, scroll down to Lightning/Thunder, and change FX Targets to this new group. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.dev for more help. Thanks!

content: Nice
Superb app very ambient and the dev support is great. Well worth it and worth getting the other two also. Firestorm and soundstorm.
replyContent: Thank you!!

content: I love it!
replyContent: Glad to hear you love the app! I hope you'll consider a 5-star rating. If you have suggestions, please contact support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.dev.

content: Great ambiance, but how to put sounds on Echo? I can only trigger it on my phone, and then it plays there.

OMG! This is amusing and wonderful! I bumped into this by accident and figured what the heck. It's only three bucks. Easy to use and quite enjoyable especially if you have a thunderstorm cranking out of your Bluetooth speaker. One footnote. It's more effective with lights you do not have direct line of sight to. For example a light bulb behind a lamp shade or in my case it was especially effective with the light strip hidden behind my television (reflecting off the wall). Thanks!
replyContent: Thank you for your review!!

content: The only paid hue app I've purchased. No regrets at all.
Nice app, great to relax with.

Cool app, but missing video option on TV after I cast my phone to TV via GHome to get sound from phone trough my home sound system. It's kinda lame to see lights & sound create nice atmosphere, but then the phone screen without anything cool matching cast to TV. Can't you add a video in the casting from the GHome app too (not just sound)? Fix this good Sir, and that last star will come flying in! :)
It's not lightning it's slow fading in and out. Nothing like a thunderstorm
replyContent: Hi Timothy, the lights pulse blue as part of the rain effects but you can turn this off under Settings. By default, the lights will flash a bright white when lightning strikes but you can change this as well. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.dev for help.

content: Love the app like to know how to cast sound and to make it little more interesting if i could cast a storm to your TV.
replyContent: Hi Michael, you can cast the audio using the Google Home app. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.dev if you need help setting this up. Thanks!

content: Really like this app. Great for Halloween. Lots of settings to play around with to get your desired effect. Even the background sounds help make for a great atmosphere. One question. Is there a way to have better control over the pulse rate or turn it off completely. Sometimes the pulse is to overwhelming even on lowest setting. Otherwise perfect.
replyContent: Hi Ari, thank you for the rating and review! You can turn off the Rain Light FX under Settings. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.dev if you need more help. Thanks!

content: Simple but awesome app. Awesome ambience and perfect light/sound sync

This is one of my favorite apps. And I have tried a lot of lightning apps. Everybody loves it when I demo Thunderstorms at parties! You have to use the Google Home app to Cast the sound and it works well. I don't know how to get 5.1 sound, but i imagine that is Google Home thing. Can the storm sounds go to more than 2 home speakers?
replyContent: Hi Cameron, thank you for the review! You can create a speaker group in the Google Home app: From 'Home', tap 'Add' and then 'Create speaker group.' You'll be able to cast to this new speaker group. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.dev if you need more help setting this up. Thanks!

content: I love this app! Only reason i have it 4 stars is because it can be better if it had the casting ability within the app added to it for audio!
replyContent: Hi Jimmy, glad to hear you love the app! You can cast the audio using the Google Home app. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.dev if you need help setting this up. Thanks!

content: amazing app, works exactly how it should, i was so impressed i also purchased the fire and music sync apps. outstanding!
replyContent: Thank you very much! Please contact support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.dev if you have any questions.

content: Takes a bit of effort to get the sound casting to the speaker but once done you get amazingly realistic lighting and thunderstorm effects!
replyContent: Thank you!

content: I love the app thus far for sleeping, is there a way to play the audio out of my google home, if not that should definitely be programed in
replyContent: Hi Jake, glad to hear you love the app! You can cast the audio using the Google Home app. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.dev if you need help setting this up. Thanks!

content: Absolutely brilliant app! I use Bluestacks on my computer and running through that.. So not to drain my phone's battery. Works perfectly, I love the customization as well.. Putting the settings on random gives the best experience with the lightning. Well worth the price!
Using this for atmosphere in my D&D games. The changing weather over time is excellent, I can set it to run and have nice dynamic changes throughout the evening. Love this!

I kind of like the idea. but have a few questions. 1. the frequency of lights doesn't match to lighting. so I want to feel like I am in the storm. even I choose high frequency, its still kind of fade in out. 2. can I play these sounds on my Google home? 3. so if.it plays on local device- can I listen any music and have the flickering effect? thank you. asking for refund and if answers will help, than will buy it again.
replyContent: Hi Vlad, please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io for help. 1. By default, the lights change blue and fade in and out as part of the rain effects. The lights will flash bright white for the lightning effects. You can change the effects in Settings. 2. You can cast audio via Google Home app. 3. You can mute audio in Settings.

content: the user interface is very confusing... how are you supposed to select a group of it doesn't show as a selection.
replyContent: Hi Eva, you can select a group or create a new group on the Groups tab. Tap the plus icon in the top right corner to create a new group or tap a group name to select it. The selected group is displayed near the top of the Storms tab. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io if you need further assistance. I'm happy to help.

content: I love this app! I live in the desert where it infrequently rains. Now it rains/storms whenever I want. (Update Complete user error on casting. I had the volume turned very low on my phone. Casting works great if you do it right and turn up the volume.)
replyContent: Hi Matt, thank you for the rating and review! Please try casting to your Google Home with the Google Home app before starting a thunderstorm. Contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io for help. Thanks!

content: I have found this App to be very good and I do like it very much.     One feature that appeals to me is that even when the App is closed (not switched off) it still runs, that enables me to cast various images or videos to my TV.  I use it on a Samsung Tab and cast using Google Home.  This all works well but is a bit fiddly to set up.    Future thoughts: ° To cast directly from the App. ° Add an image page so that a select image/video could also be cast, including a 'blank' screen.  4 stars as it could get even better.
I just bought the app tonight to use in my steam room. It was great! There are lots of settings to make the lighting just right. I used my Bluetooth shower speaker for audio. Really cool app.

Awesome app, light effects and audio are perfect. Only issue is that only philips hue COLOR bulbs react and not the white ambiance ones. I understand them not being able to perform the color cues but should be implemented for the lightning effect. I'm intrigued by the other apps you have as well but the white lights might stoo from from purchasing others.
replyContent: Hi Steven, the app does work with Hue White Ambiance lights. Please make sure these lights are in your selected group. You can also target the Hue White Ambiance for the lightning strikes by going to Settings and changing the FX Targets under Lightning/Thunder. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io for help. Thank you!

content: Impressive experience. Audio beamed to bluetooth speaker, synched perfectly with light effects. Great way to fall asleep!
very slow. was hoping for something dramatic and this fails.
replyContent: The Strong Thunderstorm mode has the fastest rain effects and the most frequent lightning strikes; however, the default settings for each mode can be overridden on the Settings screen. You can change the speed of the rain effects and the occurrence of lightning strikes, and more. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io for help.

content: Does exactly what I wanted. Very customizable!
What a great app for a lover of thunderstorms. I streamed the sound through a hifi. Great app.
replyContent: Thank you!

content: Best 2.99 I've spent in a long time. Easy to setup, easy to configure. Perfect for outdoor Halloween effects!
Disconnects from the bridge. Must be reconnected each use
replyContent: Hi Chris, you should not have to reconnect to the bridge every time you open the app. Your device may be low on memory or the bridge IP address might be changing on your network. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io for help.

content: Love this app.  But what would make it PERFECT would be if the audio could be cast (chromecast).  Any chance?
replyContent: Thank you, Kevin! You can cast the audio using the Google Home app. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io if you have any questions.

content: Fantastic app, if you want an excellent thunderstorm this is the app for you! I love it!
Awesome app, you need Google home app to complete the casting of the thunder to speakers but the lightning part is complete. PS. Needs it's own casting button for ease of use.

Fantastic app! Complete control over effects. Audio through Riva Turbo X 
sounds great, but feeding it through Sonos Play:5 shakes the house. Just 
got Firestorm, but have to wait 'til tonight to try. Gonna get Soundstorm 
next. Scott is a maestro. Edit...Demoed this app for my buddy who loves 
sleeping to thunderstorms. He bought 2 more LIFX bulbs and a Bluetooth 
speaker, and will get the app for LIFX.

Just buy it. It works wonderfully and is great for insomniacs and night 
owls.
Awesome app love it well worth the couple a bucks

Good app with lots of settings but you can't change the colour of ambiance 
bulbs through it. They just flash what ever colour their set at on the 
phillips hue app so you have to go out of this app into hue app to change 
the colour from say a standard bulb colour that you use for normal lighting 
(which ours is set at all the time) to bright white or blue which works 
best with this app
replyContent: Hi Mick, you can change the color of the bulbs for the selected lights, rain effects, and lightning effects on the Settings screen. You can also select "Revert" for the "Lights End State" to change the lights back to their original settings after you stop the storm. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io for help. Thanks!

content: Just recently ventured into the home lighting scene and came across this app.. waited till sundown.. closed the blinds and BAM!! All I can say is WOW.. once I linked to a bluetooth speaker I was blown away.. brilliant app.. keep up the good work Scott.
Awesome app!!!! Maybe native Chromecast support in the Future for audio?
replyContent: Thank you, Eric! You can cast the audio using the Google Home app. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io if you have any questions.

content: Love this app! Very customizable. For casting to Google home speakers use the Google home app setting.

Closing the app but storm sounds stay playing on device! Though the buttons are toggles it wasn't clear but if you close the app via the task manager it will continue to play sound or app setting you can force stop too.
replyContent: Hi Joe, the buttons act as toggles. You can turn off the thunderstorm by tapping the selected thunderstorm again. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io for help. Thank you.

content: Works well. Worth three bucks.

After a reply from the developer, I found a way to cast the audio through the Google Home app. Doing so changed the whole feel of the experience. Looking forward to perhaps a 5.1 or 7.1 surround version with cast from the app built in, but for now, kudos.
replyContent: Hi Matt, you can cast the audio using the Google Home app. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io for help. Thanks!

content: 100 usless garbage, only sees 2 white lights not my 12 colored lights. Dont waste your money on pure junk
replyContent: Hello, Thunderstorm for Hue does work with hue color lights. You may need to refresh the Groups/Lights tab. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io for help.

content: This app works great even with the basic white bulbs. Play around with the settings to create the storm experience you like, and use Bluetooth to rumble the thunder through some good speakers - perfect. I'm not sure what the intended purpose is, but my wife and I found a good one...
It's a good app but I wish it had native cast support

Too glitchy  Lights randomly reset to normal and then resync again to the storm.  This happens about once or twice a minute.  Only happens to some of the lights.  Kinda ruins the ambiance that your trying to create.
replyContent: Hi Adam, sorry to hear you're not having a great experience. Are you running any other hue apps at the same time? Could you please explain what you mean by the lights reset to normal? Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io for help. Thanks!

content: I absolutely love this app! My only suggestion for a future version would be to add in preset feature.

I have 6 recessed lights I switched to Hue in our living room.  This puts on a really cool show.  I even plugged my phone into the receiver and blast it on my speakers for the full effect.  It's an impressive way to show off the hue bulbs IF you have the right set up.  If all you have is a lamp, then its probably not worth the $3.  Well worth it for my setup.
You Have to link audio to Chromecast...if you do this.  would be a solid 5 stars
replyContent: Hi Jack, you can cast the audio using the Google Home app. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io for help. Thanks!

content: Love this - you can vary loads of settings to get the effect you want. Bulb set to dark blue with white lightning flashes is very cool. Worth the money. (But the Firestorm app by the same author is, by comparison, unimpressive).
Would love it if I could Chromecast the Thunder sounds to my devices.
replyContent: Hi Brian, thank you for the rating! You can cast the audio using the Google Home app. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io for help. Thanks!

content: This is really cool! I have 4 full-color hue bulbs in my bathroom and this creates a really neat effect. My little one loves it for playing in the bath. I was so impressed with this one that I purchased the fire simulator from the same developer. I'm hoping that helps enhance story time, haha.
Had some minor issues on my end. It was my fault. But received quicky response emails. Great support!

App is awesome. Need some more apps like this. Was a schmuck and bought 1st gen. Then 2nd. Now 3rd. Works through Bluetooth too!! Bluetooth your phone to speaker first, then go into app and enjoy the show! Thumbs up!

Apps like these are the reason that I decided to buy into the Hue brand. Scott answered my questions regarding casting to the Google Home and I'm really enjoying the ambient customization that this app has. Scott is out there doing some very unique things with the hardware and I hope to see even more from him in the future.
Love the app!! I emailed customer support with a question and the response was within minutes! Great customer service!!

Really great app. The only issue I have with it (and this could be user ignorance and happy to change to five star if so) is that I can't figure out how to play the sound through anything other than my phone. Doesn't seem to play through Bluetooth. I have S8
replyContent: Hi Blake, you can play the audio via Bluetooth. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io with the name of the device you're trying to connect to. Thanks!

content: This is pretty cool, I only have the white hue bulbs, but will be getting color ones soon, and I can see this will be even better with the color lights. One thing I would like to see is to be able to have audio cast onto  Google Home, and that would add the extra star. EDIT: Casting feature is possible, did not know thanks
replyContent: Hi Chris, you can cast the audio using the Google Home app on devices running Android 4.4.2 or higher. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io if you need help setting this up. Thanks!

content: Luv this, well worth every penny

Very cool!  My new favorite way to show off my Hue lights.  Unfortunately its a very expensive app because it will make you want to buy MORE Hue lights. :P    Maybe a dumb question but: How do you stop the "thunderstorm" and return to normal lighting?  The only way I have figured out is to force the app to close and then turn off the lights to reset them.   Humble suggestion:  Would it be possible to put native "google casting" into the app.  I can cast my phone's audio to the TV or Google Home, but this causes all my phone's audio to go through the speakers, ringtone and all. Just a minor wish.
replyContent: Hi Ryan, thank you for the rating! To stop the thunderstorm, you just need to tap the selected thunderstorm again. The buttons act as toggles. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io if you have any more questions. Thanks!

content: App is super cool, and makes the hue lighting that much more fun. A lot of options for a real customizable experience from rain intensity, to other noises like birds and crickets to duration of lights and even the ability to cast to a Google home/mini for audio. Very much worth the buy, you won't be disappointed!!!
Works great. I had sound issues at first which I was able to correct and they were great about responding quickly and helping correct the issue.
replyContent: Hi Elijah, the audio will play through your echo dot via Bluetooth. Echo devices only provide audio output to other speakers via aux. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io for help.

content: Great app, I love sleeping in storms and this helps get my fix. I sleep great now. There are plenty of custom options to get the perfect storm you want. It even had some extra sounds like frogs, birds, and bugs. Great hue add on app. I would rate 5 starts if you were able to chrome cast the audio to a Google home.
Scott Dodson Hue apps are simply the best out there. Lots of options able to tweak and great results. Thanks for making me happy of my hue lights purchase!
Amazing effect! Had some trouble mixing in white bulbs, shot an email and had a response extremely quickly and resolved my problems. Great support!
This is my new favorite evening app. A passing thunderstorm set on a 15 minute timer and I'm out like a light

Wonderful :) When run sing front room lights, and via Bluetooth to my Amazon Echo, in conjunction with Halloween soundtrack it's PERFECT for creating a mood outside on the street when I open the windows

Very customizable.  Can choose different lights or groups for main lighting (default blue), rain effects (mimics distant or heat lightning also default blue), and lightning flashes (nearby default white).  Each effect can have whatever color you prefer assigned, at whatever brightness.  I chose to use my white kitchen lights and ambient white hall light for the lightning strikes freeing the colored lights to maintain the other effects and shifting the bright flashes to the background, and I turned the rain effects paler greenish blue.  You can do it all with one bulb, though, if that's what you have.  The app can create new groups, not limited to one room/group per bulb like the Philips app, so you can set it up however you want to.  Volumes of rain, thunder, and background sounds (if you choose them) can be individually set also.  Has a sleep timer and reverts to prior setting on exit.

This is a great app, only complaint is the chirping noise at 01:52.431 in the tin roof rain sample which is really distracting and reveals that it's on a loop. Other than that this is very relaxing to listen to and watch.
replyContent: Hi Jayson, the latest update (2.2.2) removed the chirping noise. Thanks!

content: Great app!!!  This is one of my happiest purchases and it is truely relaxing. Developer is responsive, always open to suggestions and constantly improving the software. Highly recommended.
replyContent: Thank you for the rating and feedback! There is randomness in the lightning. The brightness, volume, and delay changes depending on the distance of the lightning strike. Normal Thunderstorm offers the widest range. You can toggle Delay Thunder under Settings. Please contact support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io for more details.

content: Edit: i initially wrote this review intending to talk about a different app. This app functions perfectly as intended, and customer service was both quick and friendly in responding. Definitely recommend!! Keeping the original review for the sake of context, but NONE of the below criticisms apply to this app:  This app was mostly good, but it crashes after a minute or two. I sleep well with thunderstorms outside, so I connected to my hue lights and streamed through Alexa to provide a good experience. However, since the app crashes very quickly, I could never fall asleep to thunderstorms--in fact, I was always startled awake by the cease of sound when the app crashed. If this was fixed, the app would easily be 5 stars.
replyContent: Thank you for updating your review and rating!

content: This app is absolutely incredible! You can tell the creator put a lot of effort in because  just when you think it's perfect he'll have an update that improves it even more. This is by far the most well thought out & put together app I've seen. I just thought he should get some credit. Keep up the good work!
Cool App but keeps making me press button on Hue hub to connect.  It should remember an authorized hub or ip every time.
replyContent: Hi Colby, thanks for the feedback! You should not have to reconnect to the bridge every time you open the app. Your device may be low on memory or the bridge IP address might be changing on your network. Please contact support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io so we can troubleshoot.

content: I like the app however when you exit this app all your light settings are changed and you have to reconfigure all of them again which is a pain I have 12 lights. hope you can improve this if so I would give it 5 stars
replyContent: Hi David, thanks for the feedback! The latest release (2.0.0) adds a "Revert lights" button under Settings. This will change the lights back to their original settings before you opened the app. Exiting the app via the back button will also trigger this action. I hope you'll consider revising your rating/review. Thank you!

content: Works well with plenty of customization. Would like to see an update that would allow for random targets to light instead or the same light or group of lights each time.
replyContent: Hi Dustin, thanks for the suggestion! The latest release (2.0.0) adds Random Group/Light to the Lightning FX Targets under Settings.

content: This is by far the best thunderstorm app I have found. And the lightning effects are awesome.
I use this app almost every night. Its like I'm reading during a thunderstorm before I go to bed.  it's very relaxing

I love this app so far. The settings are fairly easy to use. It has some very realistic thunder sounds. Helps me relax and sleep at night.                                        One suggestion would be to have the lightning strikes have a brightness scale like the rain. Can be very bright flashes. Otherwise an amazing app.              *Update*  The devs have added tons of new features and really cool controls for your hue lights. Everyone who I show loves this app. Awesome stuff!!
replyContent: Hi Kyle, thanks for the rating and review! Please contact support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io so we can work on bringing your suggested feature to the next update.

content: I seldom write reviews or rate apps. I've slept to Thunderstorms my entire life, I normally stream to Bluetooth and the phone alarm turns it off. This App made the Storm feel real. I like the sleep timer. If possible, would like to be able to adjust to a longer time and/or add an option to use as an alarm, i.e., play until [set time] it would be perfect. As soon as the storm stops I wake after years of sleeping to storms. With 6 lights on my bedroom it was quite a storm! Thank you for creating this!!!
I love it, I've seen a couple comments of people connecting the audio to their Chromecast devices. I'm not sure if I'm overlooked something obvious but I have no idea how to do so! Help?
replyContent: Hi Frankie, there isn't a cast button in the app but you can cast the sound using the Google Home app on devices running Android 4.4.2 or higher. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io if you need help setting this up. Thanks!

content: Or at leasr guve us a setting for it because i have mine hooked up to a flic button and want to trigger a storm when the button is pressed
replyContent: Hi Shashi, thanks for the rating and feedback! The latest release (1.8.0) adds Auto-start under Settings. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io if you experience any issues with this update.

content: This app works great for thunderstorms. I especially like the Chromecast audio support. Good work to the developer.
I've tried a few different options for lightning storms for hue and this is the best one out there.  A lot of different settings that you can tweak to make the storm exactly how you want it.

I have asked for a refund due to the fact that my lights go blue then white as a lightning strike hits. But then they flash several times after for no reason. Good idea but makes you feel sick with all the flashing
replyContent: Hi Kirk, on the default settings, the lights pulse blue as part of the rain effects. You can turn this off under Settings. To access Settings, tap the cog icon in the top right corner of the Thunderstorms screen. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io for more details. I'd be happy to walk you through all of the settings.

content: Very cool app, love it. Developer is quick to add features and fixed based on feedback.
replyContent: Thanks for all your help! The latest update (1.5.1) adds a background mode notification.

content: Maybe make the lightning light up random lights and not all of them possibly random lighting intensity. Also any way to use higher quality audio and I might give your app another try...
replyContent: Hi Scott, the brightness of the lightning and the volume of the thunder changes depending on the distance of the lightning strike. Normal Thunderstorm offers the widest range. For higher quality audio, try connecting your device to speakers. Update: The latest release (2.0.0) adds Random Group/Light to the Lightning FX Targets under Settings.

content: Really like this one a lot!  Very relaxing! Put your feet up,  start the storm and drift off back to that rustic cabin in the woods.

For some reason the groups were not refreshing anymore. The support team told me that this was a known bug and that I had to wait for a new version of the app to be pushed to my device. Just before the updated app arrived on my device I had removed all app data and did setup the app again. Then it was working fine for me.
replyContent: Hi Albert, please click the Groups tab and pull down on the page in order to refresh the groups list. If your groups are still not showing up in the app, please contact support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io so we can fix this issue. Edit: Thank you for updating your review and rating!

content: I love this app so far but have just one ask. You had mentioned a link for Google cast, any updates on that?
replyContent: Thanks, James! You can do this now by using the Google Cast app on devices running Android 4.4.2 or higher. Please contact me at support@thunderstorm.scottdodson.io for more details.

content: The only omission I can see from this app is the ability to cast the storm audio to a Chromecast or Audiocast. Add this feature and you'll get the fifth star 🤗
replyContent: Hi Peter, you can cast the storm audio to Chromecast Audio using the Google Cast app.

content: Great app. Discovered a bug that made the app unusable, reported it and the devs pushed an update within a couple hours. A+. App is excellent now. Enjoying it very much.
replyContent: Thank you for updating your review and rating!
